description: Add a debug mode that displays critical simulator values at each phase (similar to how Phase 1 currently shows collapse progress). Should show relevant metrics like particle counts, stellar radius, temperature, mass, etc. depending on the phase.

title: Unit tests for BlackHole class (mass, radius, accretion)
Add stellar mass loss and wind to red giant - create particle wisps and streamers flowing outward from surface, showing atmospheric escape
Task 5: Black hole mass growth and event horizon scaling
Improve phase transition smoothness - objects are abruptly disposed/replaced
description: Currently most phase transitions (except Phase 2→3) abruptly dispose of objects and replace them with new ones. Need smooth interpolated transitions between stellar evolution phases for better visual continuity.

title: Task 5: Black hole mass growth and event horizon scaling
Make nebula look and feel more like an actual nebula, less like particles
description: Current nebula is just a mass of discrete particles waiting to get sucked into the protostar. Need more atmospheric, cloud-like, volumetric appearance - like a real gaseous nebula. Should have its own visual beauty and character beyond just being 'food for the star'.

title: Add optional Earth orbit visualization for scale
Create Star.ts class for main sequence star rendering
Decrease bloom intensity on event horizon shader
description: The bloom effect on the event horizon shader is too strong/large - needs to be toned down for better visual balance.

title: Add Start Screen with title and button
description: Create a start screen UI that appears on page load, displaying 'Sun Simulator' title and a start button. Simulation should only begin after user clicks the button.

title: Add neutron star phase as alternative to black hole - supernova remnant can evolve into either neutron star or black hole based on initial star mass
Add glowing effect and consumption counter for supernova remnant accretion
description: Make the 20,000 supernova remnant particles glow orange→white as they spiral into black hole. Add statistics overlay showing 'Particles consumed: X/20,000' in real-time. Makes mass transfer visceral and visible.

title: Add massive convection cells to red giant surface - create dramatic mottled light/dark patterns using larger-scale noise, make cells as big as the original star size for Betelgeuse-scale realism
Implement Phase 3: Red Giant Expansion
Add visual debugging mode - toggle individual effects to identify sources
description: Add a debug panel or keyboard shortcuts to toggle individual visual elements on/off: accretion disk, jets, event horizon, lights (point/ambient), bloom pass, accretion streams, lensing ring. Each element should be clearly named and toggleable independently. This will help identify sources of visual effects and make debugging/tuning much easier. Could also show FPS and active particle counts.

description: Current pause and speed control implementations need to be redesigned and re-implemented from scratch for better functionality and reliability.

title: Make photon ring (Einstein ring) visible and dramatic
description: Photon ring exists but is barely visible. Make it glow bright blue-white, animate rotation to show spacetime dragging, increase intensity as black hole grows. Add subtle warping/distortion shader. This is the iconic 'Interstellar' black hole feature.

title: Expand sound effects library for more immersive audio
description: Add more sound effects beyond the initial 4: nebula swirl/whoosh (continuous), stellar wind, particle accretion stream whoosh, photon sphere hum, jet emission burst, gravitational wave pulse. Makes audio more rich and responsive to visual events.

Make main sequence solar flare photons brighter and more visible - should look like motes of light shooting off from the star surface

description: Extend the existing debug mode to work across all simulation phases (Nebula, Main Sequence, Red Giant, Supernova, Black Hole). Add phase-specific toggles, dynamic stats display, and context-aware UI. See plans/debug-mode-phase-awareness.md for full specification. Current debug mode only works for Black Hole phase - this enhancement makes it universal.

title: Make accretion disk particles more impressive (sparks/photons effect)
description: Add subtle particle swirls in accretion disk (sparks/photons effect). Particles move with disk rotation showing Keplerian velocity. Particles heat up as they approach inner edge. Creates impression of actual matter in motion. Optional modes: 'realistic' (fewer, larger) vs 'dramatic' (many particles, more visual noise).

description: Particles should visibly heat up as they approach event horizon - color shift to white-hot in final 2 seconds before consumption. Add thermal halo around accretion disk using post-processing. Increase point light intensity near black hole. Makes gravity's heating effect visible.

Make supernova flash more epic and dramatic
description:
Current supernova flash is functional but could be way more visually impressive. Ideas:
- Multiple expanding shockwave rings
- More intense color shifts
- Particle burst effects
- Screen shake/distortion effects
- Longer, more dramatic flash duration
- Add chromatic aberration or bloom effects
- Make it truly feel like galaxy-outshining explosion

Goal: Make the supernova the most memorable moment in the entire simulation.

title: Phase 5: Gravitational lensing and photon sphere
notes: Implemented gravitational lensing via post-processing UV distortion based on Schwarzschild deflection (α = 2Rs/b). Created GravitationalLensingPass with real-time strength control (0-5 range, default 0.8). Integrated into EffectComposer pipeline. Warps light around black hole for dramatic spacetime curvature visual effect. Includes debug slider for live tuning. PR #24

title: Unit tests for shader modules (AccretionDisk, EventHorizon, PhotonCorona, PhotonRing, JetTrail)
Implement explosive particle ejection system
Improve phase transition smoothness - objects are abruptly disposed/replaced
description: Currently most phase transitions (except Phase 2→3) abruptly dispose of objects and replace them with new ones. Need smooth interpolated transitions between stellar evolution phases for better visual continuity.

title: Explore larger event horizon: scale up Schwarzschild radius to fill center void more dramatically
description: Scale event horizon from initial 5 units to 8 units to fill center void more dramatically and make black hole more menacing. Keep growth range 8→15 units as mass increases.
notes: When the star sphere (25-unit radius) was accidentally left in the scene, it created a dramatic aesthetic with the accretion disk. Current event horizon is only 5 units - much smaller than disk inner edge (10 units). Explore scaling up event horizon to 8-12 units to fill the void more dramatically while keeping physics-inspired proportions. Could also explore dynamic scaling based on mass accumulation for Phase 3.

description: The debug overlay shows black hole mass and radius, but the values don't update in real-time as the black hole grows from accretion. The stats remain at initial values. Need to verify getCurrentMass() and getEventHorizonRadius() are being called correctly and that the HTML elements are updating.

description: Determine whether to use background music, what style (cinematic, ambient, documentary-style), whether it evolves with phases or is continuous, and how it interacts with sound effects and ambient soundscapes.
